newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR QUOTED MIXED AHEAD OF WEEKEND.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR QUOTED MIXED AHEAD OF WEEKEND.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed Friday's interbank session weaker on the U.S. dollar and the rand but was quoted firmer against European currencies, reflecting a stronger U.S. dollar overseas, dealers said.

"Most guys were quite short following the heavy intervention by the (central) Reserve Bank yesterday. We saw some money coming in today but it all went towards covering the shortage," one dealer commented.
The central bank has been tightly monitoring the local cudrrency to keep it at levels compatible with inflation which rose to 22.4 percent in the year to April from 19.9 percent.
The local unit finished Friday trade at 11.3150/3250 against the U.S. dollar from Thursday's 11.3075/3175 and was at 2.5225/5265 against the rand, easing slightly from 2.5200/5400 the previous day.
It however registered gains on sterling and the German mark, ending at 18.3740/4020 from 18.4400/4600 against the former and at 6.5150/5240 versus the later from 6.5400/5600.
